no, no, no - unless we totally caught an off night then I would say save yourself a LOT of money and go somewhere else.  YES - the room is beautiful and the outdoor seating is nice but the service, while very friendly, was extremely slow and almost impossible to get their attention (adverted eyes).  Most of the food was NOT good.  Two of the three "artisanal" sausage were inedible and I can eat just about anything.  The steak tartar was mediocre at best (I have had at least 10 better tartars than this).  The cheese plate was pedestrian and uninspired.  The other dishes aren't worth mentioning.  I generally do not write poor reviews unless I think "Joe Public" should have a "heads up" especially when our bill topped out over $100 Euro for what amounted to 5 tapas, a couple of  beers and a glass of wine.   We have had meals 20X better for a third of price in Gracia/Barcelona.
